intro: Ranunculus pseudophilonotis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved buttercup, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers with five petals and its finely divided, fern-like leaves. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and produces small, rounded fruits. The plant is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
